intro: Lagenophora queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland lagenophora, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the rainforests of northeastern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
